intro: Dorstenia arabica, commonly known as the Arabian false cucumber, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It is a member of the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to the harsh climate with its succulent stems. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
